comments:
With attachment 62215, when trying to create Axis2 Web service client with a non-existing project, the Axis2 core facet got installed and the Client configuration page is properly filled in.  However, when I click Finish, I got:

Exception occured while code generation the wsdl
    java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core.utils.WSDL2JavaGenerator.getAxisService(WSDL2JavaGenerator.java:378)
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core.command.Axis2ClientCodegenCommand.execute(Axis2ClientCodegenCommand.java:85)

(In reply to comment #0)
> With attachment 62215 [details], when trying to create Axis2 Web service client with a
> non-existing project, the Axis2 core facet got installed and the Client
> configuration page is properly filled in.  However, when I click Finish, I got:
> 
> Exception occured while code generation the wsdl
>     java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
>     at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
>     at
> sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
>     at
> sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
>     at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
>     at
> org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core.utils.WSDL2JavaGenerator.getAxisService(WSDL2JavaGenerator.java:378)
>     at
> org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core.command.Axis2ClientCodegenCommand.execute(Axis2ClientCodegenCommand.java:85)
> 

Hi ,  

I guess we have two options for this 

1) generate a the code into a default generated project (As normally named WebServiceProject) 
2) We inform the user 
i) at the end of the scenario that there has been no existing project selected -> so aboart
ii) Invalidate the page if there is no project selected at the start

I guess the first one is the correct solution for this also there can be no 2)ii) even we can live with having 2)i) 

just for clarifying things. 

Thanks 

Lahiru
This problem does not exist with the 05/02 WTP 2.0 driver.
